00027 
00028 This module provides a standard socket-like interface for Python
00029 for tunneling connections through SOCKS proxies.
00030 
00031 """
00032 
00033 """
00034 
00035 Minor modifications made by Christopher Gilbert (http://motomastyle.com/)
00036 for use in PyLoris (http://pyloris.sourceforge.net/)

00042 
00043 import base64
00044 import socket
00045 import struct
00046 import sys
00047 
00048 if getattr(socket, 'socket', None) is None:
00049     raise ImportError('socket.socket missing, proxy support unusable')
00050 
00051 PROXY_TYPE_SOCKS4 = 1
00052 PROXY_TYPE_SOCKS5 = 2
00053 PROXY_TYPE_HTTP = 3
00054 PROXY_TYPE_HTTP_NO_TUNNEL = 4
00055 
00056 _defaultproxy = None
00057 _orgsocket = socket.socket
00058 
00059 class ProxyError(Exception): pass
00060 class GeneralProxyError(ProxyError): pass
00061 class Socks5AuthError(ProxyError): pass
00062 class Socks5Error(ProxyError): pass
00063 class Socks4Error(ProxyError): pass
00064 class HTTPError(ProxyError): pass
00065 
00066 _generalerrors = ("success",
00067     "invalid data",
00068     "not connected",
00069     "not available",
00070     "bad proxy type",
00071     "bad input")
00072 
00073 _socks5errors = ("succeeded",
00074     "general SOCKS server failure",
00075     "connection not allowed by ruleset",
00076     "Network unreachable",
00077     "Host unreachable",
00078     "Connection refused",
00079     "TTL expired",
00080     "Command not supported",
00081     "Address type not supported",
00082     "Unknown error")
00083 
00084 _socks5autherrors = ("succeeded",
00085     "authentication is required",
00086     "all offered authentication methods were rejected",
00087     "unknown username or invalid password",
00088     "unknown error")
00089 
00090 _socks4errors = ("request granted",
00091     "request rejected or failed",
00092     "request rejected because SOCKS server cannot connect to identd on the client",
00093     "request rejected because the client program and identd report different user-ids",
00094     "unknown error")
00095 
00096 def setdefaultproxy(proxytype=None, addr=None, port=None, rdns=True, username=None, password=None):
00097     """setdefaultproxy(proxytype, addr[, port[, rdns[, username[, password]]]])
00098     Sets a default proxy which all further socksocket objects will use,
00099     unless explicitly changed.
00100     """
00101     global _defaultproxy
00102     _defaultproxy = (proxytype, addr, port, rdns, username, password)
00103 
00104 def wrapmodule(module):
00105     """wrapmodule(module)
00106     Attempts to replace a module's socket library with a SOCKS socket. Must set
00107     a default proxy using setdefaultproxy(...) first.
00108     This will only work on modules that import socket directly into the namespace;
00109     most of the Python Standard Library falls into this category.
00110     """
00111     if _defaultproxy != None:
00112         module.socket.socket = socksocket
00113     else:
00114         raise GeneralProxyError((4, "no proxy specified"))
00115 
00116 class socksocket(socket.socket):
00117     """socksocket([family[, type[, proto]]]) -> socket object
00118     Open a SOCKS enabled socket. The parameters are the same as
00119     those of the standard socket init. In order for SOCKS to work,
00120     you must specify family=AF_INET, type=SOCK_STREAM and proto=0.
00121     """
00122 
00123     def __init__(self, family=socket.AF_INET, type=socket.SOCK_STREAM, proto=0, _sock=None):
00124         _orgsocket.__init__(self, family, type, proto, _sock)
00125         if _defaultproxy != None:
00126             self.__proxy = _defaultproxy
00127         else:
00128             self.__proxy = (None, None, None, None, None, None)
00129         self.__proxysockname = None
00130         self.__proxypeername = None
00131         self.__httptunnel = True
00132 
00133     def __recvall(self, count):
00134         """__recvall(count) -> data
00135         Receive EXACTLY the number of bytes requested from the socket.
00136         Blocks until the required number of bytes have been received.
00137         """
00138         data = self.recv(count)
00139         while len(data) < count:
00140             d = self.recv(count-len(data))
00141             if not d: raise GeneralProxyError((0, "connection closed unexpectedly"))
00142             data = data + d
00143         return data
00144 
00145     def sendall(self, content, *args):
00146         """ override socket.socket.sendall method to rewrite the header
00147         for non-tunneling proxies if needed
00148         """
00149         if not self.__httptunnel:
00150             content = self.__rewriteproxy(content)
00151         return super(socksocket, self).sendall(content, *args)
00152 
00153     def __rewriteproxy(self, header):
00154         """ rewrite HTTP request headers to support non-tunneling proxies
00155         (i.e. those which do not support the CONNECT method).
00156         This only works for HTTP (not HTTPS) since HTTPS requires tunneling.
00157         """
00158         host, endpt = None, None
00159         hdrs = header.split("\r\n")
00160         for hdr in hdrs:
00161             if hdr.lower().startswith("host:"):
00162                 host = hdr
00163             elif hdr.lower().startswith("get") or hdr.lower().startswith("post"):
00164                 endpt = hdr
00165         if host and endpt:
00166             hdrs.remove(host)
00167             hdrs.remove(endpt)
00168             host = host.split(" ")[1]
00169             endpt = endpt.split(" ")
00170             if (self.__proxy[4] != None and self.__proxy[5] != None):
00171                 hdrs.insert(0, self.__getauthheader())
00172             hdrs.insert(0, "Host: %s" % host)
00173             hdrs.insert(0, "%s http://%s%s %s" % (endpt[0], host, endpt[1], endpt[2]))
00174         return "\r\n".join(hdrs)
00175 
00176     def __getauthheader(self):
00177         auth = self.__proxy[4] + ":" + self.__proxy[5]
00178         return "Proxy-Authorization: Basic " + base64.b64encode(auth)
00179 
00180     def setproxy(self, proxytype=None, addr=None, port=None, rdns=True, username=None, password=None):
00181         """setproxy(proxytype, addr[, port[, rdns[, username[, password]]]])
00182         Sets the proxy to be used.
00183         proxytype -    The type of the proxy to be used. Three types
00184                 are supported: PROXY_TYPE_SOCKS4 (including socks4a),
00185                 PROXY_TYPE_SOCKS5 and PROXY_TYPE_HTTP
00186         addr -        The address of the server (IP or DNS).
00187         port -        The port of the server. Defaults to 1080 for SOCKS
00188                 servers and 8080 for HTTP proxy servers.
00189         rdns -        Should DNS queries be preformed on the remote side
00190                 (rather than the local side). The default is True.
00191                 Note: This has no effect with SOCKS4 servers.
00192         username -    Username to authenticate with to the server.
00193                 The default is no authentication.
00194         password -    Password to authenticate with to the server.
00195                 Only relevant when username is also provided.
00196         """
00197         self.__proxy = (proxytype, addr, port, rdns, username, password)
00198 
00199     def __negotiatesocks5(self, destaddr, destport):
00200         """__negotiatesocks5(self,destaddr,destport)
00201         Negotiates a connection through a SOCKS5 server.
00202         """
00203         # First we'll send the authentication packages we support.
00204         if (self.__proxy[4]!=None) and (self.__proxy[5]!=None):
00205             # The username/password details were supplied to the
00206             # setproxy method so we support the USERNAME/PASSWORD
00207             # authentication (in addition to the standard none).
00208             self.sendall(struct.pack('BBBB', 0x05, 0x02, 0x00, 0x02))
00209         else:
00210             # No username/password were entered, therefore we
00211             # only support connections with no authentication.
00212             self.sendall(struct.pack('BBB', 0x05, 0x01, 0x00))
00213         # We'll receive the server's response to determine which
00214         # method was selected
00215         chosenauth = self.__recvall(2)
00216         if chosenauth[0:1] != chr(0x05).encode():
00217             self.close()
00218             raise GeneralProxyError((1, _generalerrors[1]))
00219         # Check the chosen authentication method
00220         if chosenauth[1:2] == chr(0x00).encode():
00221             # No authentication is required
00222             pass
00223         elif chosenauth[1:2] == chr(0x02).encode():
00224             # Okay, we need to perform a basic username/password
00225             # authentication.
00226             self.sendall(chr(0x01).encode() + chr(len(self.__proxy[4])) + self.__proxy[4] + chr(len(self.__proxy[5])) + self.__proxy[5])
00227             authstat = self.__recvall(2)
00228             if authstat[0:1] != chr(0x01).encode():
00229                 # Bad response
00230                 self.close()
00231                 raise GeneralProxyError((1, _generalerrors[1]))
00232             if authstat[1:2] != chr(0x00).encode():
00233                 # Authentication failed
00234                 self.close()
00235                 raise Socks5AuthError((3, _socks5autherrors[3]))
00236             # Authentication succeeded
00237         else:
00238             # Reaching here is always bad
00239             self.close()
00240             if chosenauth[1] == chr(0xFF).encode():
00241                 raise Socks5AuthError((2, _socks5autherrors[2]))
00242             else:
00243                 raise GeneralProxyError((1, _generalerrors[1]))
00244         # Now we can request the actual connection
00245         req = struct.pack('BBB', 0x05, 0x01, 0x00)
00246         # If the given destination address is an IP address, we'll
00247         # use the IPv4 address request even if remote resolving was specified.
00248         try:
00249             ipaddr = socket.inet_aton(destaddr)
00250             req = req + chr(0x01).encode() + ipaddr
00251         except socket.error:
00252             # Well it's not an IP number,  so it's probably a DNS name.
00253             if self.__proxy[3]:
00254                 # Resolve remotely
00255                 ipaddr = None
00256                 req = req + chr(0x03).encode() + chr(len(destaddr)).encode() + destaddr
00257             else:
00258                 # Resolve locally
00259                 ipaddr = socket.inet_aton(socket.gethostbyname(destaddr))
00260                 req = req + chr(0x01).encode() + ipaddr
00261         req = req + struct.pack(">H", destport)
00262         self.sendall(req)
00263         # Get the response
00264         resp = self.__recvall(4)
00265         if resp[0:1] != chr(0x05).encode():
00266             self.close()
00267             raise GeneralProxyError((1, _generalerrors[1]))
00268         elif resp[1:2] != chr(0x00).encode():
00269             # Connection failed
00270             self.close()
00271             if ord(resp[1:2])<=8:
00272                 raise Socks5Error((ord(resp[1:2]), _socks5errors[ord(resp[1:2])]))
00273             else:
00274                 raise Socks5Error((9, _socks5errors[9]))
00275         # Get the bound address/port
00276         elif resp[3:4] == chr(0x01).encode():
00277             boundaddr = self.__recvall(4)
00278         elif resp[3:4] == chr(0x03).encode():
00279             resp = resp + self.recv(1)
00280             boundaddr = self.__recvall(ord(resp[4:5]))
00281         else:
00282             self.close()
00283             raise GeneralProxyError((1,_generalerrors[1]))
00284         boundport = struct.unpack(">H", self.__recvall(2))[0]
00285         self.__proxysockname = (boundaddr, boundport)
00286         if ipaddr != None:
00287             self.__proxypeername = (socket.inet_ntoa(ipaddr), destport)
00288         else:
00289             self.__proxypeername = (destaddr, destport)
00290 
00291     def getproxysockname(self):
00292         """getsockname() -> address info
00293         Returns the bound IP address and port number at the proxy.
00294         """
00295         return self.__proxysockname
00296 
00297     def getproxypeername(self):
00298         """getproxypeername() -> address info
00299         Returns the IP and port number of the proxy.
00300         """
00301         return _orgsocket.getpeername(self)
00302 
00303     def getpeername(self):
00304         """getpeername() -> address info
00305         Returns the IP address and port number of the destination
00306         machine (note: getproxypeername returns the proxy)
00307         """
00308         return self.__proxypeername
00309 
00310     def __negotiatesocks4(self,destaddr,destport):
00311         """__negotiatesocks4(self,destaddr,destport)
00312         Negotiates a connection through a SOCKS4 server.
00313         """
00314         # Check if the destination address provided is an IP address
00315         rmtrslv = False
00316         try:
00317             ipaddr = socket.inet_aton(destaddr)
00318         except socket.error:
00319             # It's a DNS name. Check where it should be resolved.
00320             if self.__proxy[3]:
00321                 ipaddr = struct.pack("BBBB", 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x01)
00322                 rmtrslv = True
00323             else:
00324                 ipaddr = socket.inet_aton(socket.gethostbyname(destaddr))
00325         # Construct the request packet
00326         req = struct.pack(">BBH", 0x04, 0x01, destport) + ipaddr
00327         # The username parameter is considered userid for SOCKS4
00328         if self.__proxy[4] != None:
00329             req = req + self.__proxy[4]
00330         req = req + chr(0x00).encode()
00331         # DNS name if remote resolving is required
00332         # NOTE: This is actually an extension to the SOCKS4 protocol
00333         # called SOCKS4A and may not be supported in all cases.
00334         if rmtrslv:
00335             req = req + destaddr + chr(0x00).encode()
00336         self.sendall(req)
00337         # Get the response from the server
00338         resp = self.__recvall(8)
00339         if resp[0:1] != chr(0x00).encode():
00340             # Bad data
00341             self.close()
00342             raise GeneralProxyError((1,_generalerrors[1]))
00343         if resp[1:2] != chr(0x5A).encode():
00344             # Server returned an error
00345             self.close()
00346             if ord(resp[1:2]) in (91, 92, 93):
00347                 self.close()
00348                 raise Socks4Error((ord(resp[1:2]), _socks4errors[ord(resp[1:2]) - 90]))
00349             else:
00350                 raise Socks4Error((94, _socks4errors[4]))
00351         # Get the bound address/port
00352         self.__proxysockname = (socket.inet_ntoa(resp[4:]), struct.unpack(">H", resp[2:4])[0])
00353         if rmtrslv != None:
00354             self.__proxypeername = (socket.inet_ntoa(ipaddr), destport)
00355         else:
00356             self.__proxypeername = (destaddr, destport)
00357 
00358     def __negotiatehttp(self, destaddr, destport):
00359         """__negotiatehttp(self,destaddr,destport)
00360         Negotiates a connection through an HTTP server.
00361         """
00362         # If we need to resolve locally, we do this now
00363         if not self.__proxy[3]:
00364             addr = socket.gethostbyname(destaddr)
00365         else:
00366             addr = destaddr
00367         headers =  ["CONNECT ", addr, ":", str(destport), " HTTP/1.1\r\n"]
00368         headers += ["Host: ", destaddr, "\r\n"]
00369         if (self.__proxy[4] != None and self.__proxy[5] != None):
00370                 headers += [self.__getauthheader(), "\r\n"]
00371         headers.append("\r\n")
00372         self.sendall("".join(headers).encode())
00373         # We read the response until we get the string "\r\n\r\n"
00374         resp = self.recv(1)
00375         while resp.find("\r\n\r\n".encode()) == -1:
00376             resp = resp + self.recv(1)
00377         # We just need the first line to check if the connection
00378         # was successful
00379         statusline = resp.splitlines()[0].split(" ".encode(), 2)
00380         if statusline[0] not in ("HTTP/1.0".encode(), "HTTP/1.1".encode()):
00381             self.close()
00382             raise GeneralProxyError((1, _generalerrors[1]))
00383         try:
00384             statuscode = int(statusline[1])
00385         except ValueError:
00386             self.close()
00387             raise GeneralProxyError((1, _generalerrors[1]))
00388         if statuscode != 200:
00389             self.close()
00390             raise HTTPError((statuscode, statusline[2]))
00391         self.__proxysockname = ("0.0.0.0", 0)
00392         self.__proxypeername = (addr, destport)
00393 
00394     def connect(self, destpair):
00395         """connect(self, despair)
00396         Connects to the specified destination through a proxy.
00397         destpar - A tuple of the IP/DNS address and the port number.
00398         (identical to socket's connect).
00399         To select the proxy server use setproxy().
00400         """
00401         # Do a minimal input check first
00402         if (not type(destpair) in (list,tuple)) or (len(destpair) < 2) or (not isinstance(destpair[0], basestring)) or (type(destpair[1]) != int):
00403             raise GeneralProxyError((5, _generalerrors[5]))
00404         if self.__proxy[0] == PROXY_TYPE_SOCKS5:
00405             if self.__proxy[2] != None:
00406                 portnum = self.__proxy[2]
00407             else:
00408                 portnum = 1080
00409             _orgsocket.connect(self, (self.__proxy[1], portnum))
00410             self.__negotiatesocks5(destpair[0], destpair[1])
00411         elif self.__proxy[0] == PROXY_TYPE_SOCKS4:
00412             if self.__proxy[2] != None:
00413                 portnum = self.__proxy[2]
00414             else:
00415                 portnum = 1080
00416             _orgsocket.connect(self,(self.__proxy[1], portnum))
00417             self.__negotiatesocks4(destpair[0], destpair[1])
00418         elif self.__proxy[0] == PROXY_TYPE_HTTP:
00419             if self.__proxy[2] != None:
00420                 portnum = self.__proxy[2]
00421             else:
00422                 portnum = 8080
00423             _orgsocket.connect(self,(self.__proxy[1], portnum))
00424             self.__negotiatehttp(destpair[0], destpair[1])
00425         elif self.__proxy[0] == PROXY_TYPE_HTTP_NO_TUNNEL:
00426             if self.__proxy[2] != None:
00427                 portnum = self.__proxy[2]
00428             else:
00429                 portnum = 8080
00430             _orgsocket.connect(self,(self.__proxy[1],portnum))
00431             if destpair[1] == 443:
00432                 self.__negotiatehttp(destpair[0],destpair[1])
00433             else:
00434                 self.__httptunnel = False
00435         elif self.__proxy[0] == None:
00436             _orgsocket.connect(self, (destpair[0], destpair[1]))
00437         else:
00438             raise GeneralProxyError((4, _generalerrors[4]))
